page.title: 03Farmers
page.content: Potatoes and turnips are sold locally by the farmers who grow them. Pasteurised milk can be bought 3 times a week when it is brought from the dairy at Hexham. Otherwise people use UHT or dried milk which they can buy at the post office at Lanehead or in the shops at Bellingham. A few people use untreated milk from their own cows. A few people have their own hens or bantams and produce their own eggs. Otherwise we buy them at Bellingham, or the post office. A baker and greengrocer's van travels to most of the area once or twice a week. He sells bread, cakes, fruit and vegetables and most groceries. The drivers make friends with the dogs on their route by feeding them stale buns.
